resources.string: Are you sure \n\ You want to exit the application ?
Please select a valid earlier date
No vaccine details available for this pet.
Enter the name of your pet
How can i add details of a Veterinary Doctor

You can add a Doctor detail by going to the Doctors page and clicking on the "+" button in the actionbar. At the moment the following details can be saved for a Doctor.
\ 
\ 	1.\ Firstname *
\ 	2.\ Lastname
\ 	3.\ EmailID
\ 	4.\ Primary Phone Number *
\ 	5.\ Secondary Phone Number
\ 	6.\ Address
\ 
\ Click Save button to record doctor information.
\ (*) - Mandatory fields
\ 
\
How can i edit details of a particular Doctor

You can edit a particular doctor detail inside the Doctors page.
\ 	1.\ Click and select a Doctor from the list whose details needs to be modified.
\ 	2.\ Click the “Edit” button.
\ 	3.\ Make required changes in the Doctor data.
\ 	4.\ Click Save button to persist the modified data.
\ At the moment the following details can be modified for a Doctor.
\ 
\ 	1.\ Firstname *
\ 	2.\ Lastname
\ 	3.\ EmailID
\ 	4.\ Primary Phone Number *
\ 	5.\ Secondary Phone Number
\ 	6.\ Address
\ 
\ Click Save button to save the doctor information changes.
\ (*) - Mandatory fields
\ 
\
How do i place a phone call to a Doctor ?

You can place a phone call to a particular doctor from the Doctors page provided there is a minimum of one doctor entry present.
\ 
\ 	1.\ Enter the Doctors page from the Options page.
\ 	2.\ Click / Press the "Call" icon next to the doctor for whom the phone call has to be placed.
\ 	3.\ The app shall request for the user permission to dial the primary phone number of the doctor.
\ 	4.\ On user acceptance the app shall initiate a phone call to the doctor's primary contact number.
\
How can i add details for a pet ?

You can add a pet detail by going to the Pets page and clicking on the "+" button. Click on the "Save" button to save the entered details of your pet. At the moment the following details can be saved for your pet.
\ 
\ 	1.\ Name of the pet.
\ 	2.\ Date of Birth.
\ 	3.\ Sex.
\ 	4.\ Microchip ID.
\ 	5.\ Registration ID.
\
How do i edit details of a particular pet ?.

1.\ Click and select a Pet from the list whose details needs to be modified. 	2.\ Click the “Edit” button. 	3.\ Make required changes in the Pet data. 	4.\ Click Save button to persist the modified data.
\ At the moment the following details can be modified for a pet.
\ 
\ 	1.\ Name of the pet.
\ 	2.\ Date of Birth.
\ 	3.\ Sex.
\ 	4.\ Microchip ID.
\ 	5.\ Registration ID.
\
How can I view the Vaccination history of a Pet ?

You can view the vaccination history of a particular pet inside the Pets page. From the list of available pets click and select a pet for which the vaccination details needs to be accessed. Click the “Vaccine” button to view the vaccination history for that pet. \n\ \n\ NOTE: You can share the vaccination history data via mail by clicking the "Share" icon present on the actionbar.
How do i add a vaccine detail for a pet ?

You can add a vaccination detail for a pet from the Vaccine page. 
\ 	1.\ Click on the Vaccine Details option in the "Options" page.
\ 	2.\ Select the Doctor from the doctors list responsible for administering the vaccine.
\ 	3.\ Select the Pet from the list for which the vaccination was administered.
\ 	4.\ Select the type of Vaccination that was administered to the pet. 	4.\ Select the next due date for the Vaccine.
\ 	5.\ Click on "Save" button to record the vaccination entry detail.
\ 
\ NOTE: The user can save the next vaccination due date as a google calendar event.
Save vaccine details as a google calendar event

To add the next vaccination due date as a google calendar event. 
\ 	1.\ Click on the Vaccine Details option in the "Options" page.
\ 	2.\ Select the Doctor from the doctors list responsible for administering the vaccine.
\ 	3.\ Select the Pet from the list for which the vaccination was administered.
\ 	4.\ Select the type of Vaccination that was administered to the pet. 	4.\ Select the next due date for the Vaccine.
\ 	5.\ Click on "Save" button to record the vaccination entry detail.
\ 	6.\ The Google Calendar app shall prompt with a popup window through which you can save the next vaccination due date.
\

\ The following information on vaccination schedule shall serve as a Reference in general. The information presented here may vary based on your present geographical location. It's always a safe practice to consult your veterinarian before administering any sort of vaccination to your pet. The Veterinarian is the right person to determine the vaccine,the dosage of vaccine that will provide the safest and best protection for your pet depending on the age,breed,size, ingredients of vaccine, vaccination history, neutered status and other factors.
\
The VACCINATION GUIDELINES GROUP (VGG) OF THE WORLD SMALL ANIMAL VETERINARY ASSOCIATION (WSAVA) has categorized vaccinations into two broad categories.
\ 
\ 	1.\ Core vaccines.
\ 	2.\ Non-Core vaccines.
\ 
\ 	1.\ Core vaccines 
\ Core vaccines protect animals from severe, life-threatening diseases that have global distribution and every pet regardless of circumstances, should receive.
\ 
\ Core vaccines for dogs are those that protect from 
\ 
\ 	1.\ Canine Parvovirus-2[CPV-2,MLV,Parental].
\ 	2.\ Canine Distemper Virus[CDV,MLV,Parental].
\ 	3.\ Canine Adenovirus-2 [Hepatitis].
\ 	4.\ Rabies virus.
\ 
\ 
\ Core vaccines for cats are those that protect against 
\ 
\ 	1.\ Feline Panleukopenia(Distemper).
\ 	2.\ Feline Leukemia Virus (FELV).
\ 	3.\ Feline Calcivirus [FCV].
\ 	3.\ Pneumonitis (Chlamydiosis).
\ 	4.\ Rabies virus.
\ 
\ 	2.\ Non-Core Vaccines Non-Core vaccines are required by only those animals whose geographical location, local environment or lifestyle places them at risk of contracting specific infections.
\ 
\ Non core vaccines for Dogs protects against 
\ Bordetella bronchiseptica, Borrelia burgdorferi and Leptospira bacteria
\. 
\ For Cats, the Non-Core vaccines protects against 
\ Feline leukemia virus (FeLV), Feline immunodeficiency virus, Bordetella [kennel cough]

Every pet regardless of circumstances should receive its dose of Core vaccines to protect itself from severe, life-threatening diseases that have global distribution.
\ 
\ According to the canine vaccination guideline issued by WSAVA, Every pup post 9 weeks of age shall be administered primary vaccination course to protect against
\ 
\ 	1.\ Canine Parvovirus-2[CPV-2,MLV,Parental].
\ 	2.\ Canine Distemper Virus[CDV,MLV,Parental].
\ 	3.\ Canine Adenovirus-2 [Hepatitis].
\ 	4.\ Rabies virus.
\ 
\ Schedule for CORE vaccines
\ 
\ Age 	\ 	\ 	\ Core(Recommended) 
\ 6 - 8 weeks 	\ 	\ Distemper,Hepatitis,Parainfluenza,Parvovirus (DHPP)
\ 10 - 12 weeks 	\ 	\ Distemper,Hepatitis,Leptospirosis, Parainfluenza,Parvovirus (DHLPP)
\ 12 - 16 weeks 	\ 	\ (DHLPP) + Rabies
\ 1 year 	\ 	\ (DHLPP), Rabies. 
\ 
\ Schedule for Non-CORE vaccines
\ 
\ Age 	\ 	\ 	\ Non-Core 
\ 6 - 8 weeks 	\ 	\ Bordetella 
\ 10 - 12 weeks 	\ 	\ Coronavirus
\ 12 - 16 weeks 	\ 	\ Lyme 
\ 1 year 	\ 	\ Bordetella,Coronavirus,Lyme. 
\ 
\ Revaccination.
\ A single dose is given 1 year following the last dose of the initial series, then no more frequently than every 3 years.
\ 
\

\ According to the Feline Vaccination Guideline issued by WSAVA, Every kitten post 9 weeks of age shall be administered primary vaccination course to protect against
\ 
\ 	1.\ Feline Panleukopenia(Distemper).
\ 	2.\ Feline Leukemia Virus (FELV).
\ 	3.\ Feline Calcivirus [FCV].
\ 	3.\ Pneumonitis (Chlamydiosis).
\ 	4.\ Rabies virus.
\ 
\ Schedule for CORE vaccines
\ 
\ Age 	\ 	\ 	\ Core(Recommended) 
\ 6 - 8 weeks 	\ 	\ Feline Distemper,Rhinotracheitis,Calcivirus
\ 10 - 12 weeks 	\ 	\ 2nd Core Vaccination
\ 12 - 16 weeks 	\ 	\ Rabies
\ 14 - 16 weeks 	\ 	\ 3rd Core Vaccination
\ 1 year 	\ 	\ Core vaccination, Rabies. 
\ 
\ Schedule for Non-CORE vaccines
\ 
\ Age 	\ 	\ 	\ Non-Core 
\ 6 - 8 weeks 	\ 	\ Chlamydia 
\ 10 - 12 weeks 	\ 	\ Feline Leukemia
\ 12 - 16 weeks 	\ 	\ NA 
\ 14 - 16 weeks 	\ 	\ NA 
\ 1 year 	\ 	\ Chlamydia, Feline Leukemia. 
\ 
\ Revaccination.
\ A single dose is given 1 year following the last dose of the initial series, then no more frequently than every 3 years.
\ 
\
Make a call to the default Doctor
"Locate nearest vet clinics based on the present location"
